TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed FinancialFormula extends System.Enum

summary.span: Specifies a financial formula.

span.span: Specifies a financial formula.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Перечисление используется в вызовах `FinancialFormula` методы, содержащиеся в класса и указывает тип финансовые формулы для использования.The enumeration is used in calls to the `FinancialFormula` methods that are contained in the class, and specifies the type of financial formula to be used.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.FinancialFormula AccumulationDistribution = int32(0)

summary.span: Accumulation Distribution formula uses a relationship between volume and prices to estimate the strength of price movements; if volume is increased, there is a high probability that prices will go up.

span.span: Accumulation Distribution formula uses a relationship between volume and prices to estimate the strength of price movements; if volume is increased, there is a high probability that prices will go up.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.FinancialFormula AverageTrueRange = int32(1)

summary.span: Average True Range indicator measures commitment and compares the range between the High, Low and Close prices.

span.span: Average True Range indicator measures commitment and compares the range between the High, Low and Close prices.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.FinancialFormula BollingerBands = int32(2)

summary.span: Bollinger Bands indicators are plotted at standard deviation levels above and below a simple moving average.

span.span: Bollinger Bands indicators are plotted at standard deviation levels above and below a simple moving average.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.FinancialFormula ChaikinOscillator = int32(3)

summary.span: Chaikin Oscillator indicator is the difference between a 3-day exponential moving average and a 10-day exponential moving average applied to the accumulation distribution.

span.span: Chaikin Oscillator indicator is the difference between a 3-day exponential moving average and a 10-day exponential moving average applied to the accumulation distribution.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.FinancialFormula CommodityChannelIndex = int32(4)

summary.span: Commodity Channel Index compares prices with their moving averages.

span.span: Commodity Channel Index compares prices with their moving averages.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.FinancialFormula DetrendedPriceOscillator = int32(5)

summary.span: Detrended Price Oscillator attempts to remove trends from prices.

span.span: Detrended Price Oscillator attempts to remove trends from prices.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.FinancialFormula EaseOfMovement = int32(6)

summary.span: Ease of Movement deals with the relationship between volume and price change, and uses volume to indicate how strong a trend is for prices.

span.span: Ease of Movement deals with the relationship between volume and price change, and uses volume to indicate how strong a trend is for prices.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.FinancialFormula Envelopes = int32(7)

summary.span: Envelopes are plotted above and below a moving average using a specified percentage as the shift.

span.span: Envelopes are plotted above and below a moving average using a specified percentage as the shift.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.FinancialFormula ExponentialMovingAverage = int32(8)

summary.span: An Exponential Moving Average is an average of data calculated over a period of time where the most recent days have more weight.

span.span: An Exponential Moving Average is an average of data calculated over a period of time where the most recent days have more weight.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.FinancialFormula Forecasting = int32(9)

summary.span: Forecasting predicts future values using historical observations.

span.span: Forecasting predicts future values using historical observations.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.FinancialFormula MassIndex = int32(11)

summary.span: The Mass Index is used to predict trend reversal by comparing the difference and range between High and Low prices.

span.span: The Mass Index is used to predict trend reversal by comparing the difference and range between High and Low prices.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.FinancialFormula MedianPrice = int32(12)

summary.span: Median prices are mid-point values of daily prices and can be used as a filter for trend indicators.

span.span: Median prices are mid-point values of daily prices and can be used as a filter for trend indicators.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.FinancialFormula MoneyFlow = int32(13)

summary.span: The Money Flow indicator compares upward changes and downward changes of volume-weighted typical prices.

span.span: The Money Flow indicator compares upward changes and downward changes of volume-weighted typical prices.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.FinancialFormula MovingAverage = int32(21)

summary.span: A Simple Moving Average is an average of data calculated over a period of time.

span.span: A Simple Moving Average is an average of data calculated over a period of time.

summary.span: The moving average is the most popular price indicator used in technical analysis, and can be used with any price, for example, Hi, Low, Open and Close, or can be applied to other indicators.

span.span: The moving average is the most popular price indicator used in technical analysis, and can be used with any price, for example, Hi, Low, Open and Close, or can be applied to other indicators.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.FinancialFormula MovingAverageConvergenceDivergence = int32(10)

summary.span: Moving Average Convergence/Divergence indicator compares two moving averages of prices and is used with a 9-day Exponential Moving average as a signal that indicates buying and selling moments.

span.span: Moving Average Convergence/Divergence indicator compares two moving averages of prices and is used with a 9-day Exponential Moving average as a signal that indicates buying and selling moments.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.FinancialFormula NegativeVolumeIndex = int32(14)

summary.span: The Negative Volume Index should be used with the Positive Volume index; the Negative Volume Index only changes if the volume decreases from the previous day.

span.span: The Negative Volume Index should be used with the Positive Volume index; the Negative Volume Index only changes if the volume decreases from the previous day.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.FinancialFormula OnBalanceVolume = int32(15)

summary.span: The On Balance Volume indicator measures positive and negative volume flow.

span.span: The On Balance Volume indicator measures positive and negative volume flow.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.FinancialFormula Performance = int32(16)

summary.span: The Performance indicator compares a current closing price or any other price with the first closing value from the first time period.

span.span: The Performance indicator compares a current closing price or any other price with the first closing value from the first time period.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.FinancialFormula PositiveVolumeIndex = int32(17)

summary.span: The Positive Volume Index should be used with the Negative Volume index.

span.span: The Positive Volume Index should be used with the Negative Volume index.

summary.span: The Positive volume index only changes if the volume decreases from the previous day.

span.span: The Positive volume index only changes if the volume decreases from the previous day.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.FinancialFormula PriceVolumeTrend = int32(18)

summary.span: The Price Volume Trend is a cumulative volume total that is calculated using relative changes of the closing price, and should be used with other indicators.

span.span: The Price Volume Trend is a cumulative volume total that is calculated using relative changes of the closing price, and should be used with other indicators.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.FinancialFormula RateOfChange = int32(19)

summary.span: The Rate of Change indicator compares a specified closing price with the current price.

span.span: The Rate of Change indicator compares a specified closing price with the current price.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.FinancialFormula RelativeStrengthIndex = int32(20)

summary.span: The Relative Strength Index is a momentum oscillator that compares upward movements of the closing price with downward movements, and results in values that range from 0 to 100.

span.span: The Relative Strength Index is a momentum oscillator that compares upward movements of the closing price with downward movements, and results in values that range from 0 to 100.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.FinancialFormula StandardDeviation = int32(22)

summary.span: Standard Deviation is used to indicate volatility, and measures the difference between values, for example, closing price, and their moving average.

span.span: Standard Deviation is used to indicate volatility, and measures the difference between values, for example, closing price, and their moving average.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.FinancialFormula StochasticIndicator = int32(23)

summary.span: The Stochastic Indicator helps to find trend reversal by searching in a period for when the closing prices are close to low prices in an upward trending market and when the closing prices are close to high prices in a downward trending market.

span.span: The Stochastic Indicator helps to find trend reversal by searching in a period for when the closing prices are close to low prices in an upward trending market and when the closing prices are close to high prices in a downward trending market.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.FinancialFormula TriangularMovingAverage = int32(24)

summary.span: A Triangular Moving Average is an average of data calculated over a period of time where the middle portion of data has more weight.

span.span: A Triangular Moving Average is an average of data calculated over a period of time where the middle portion of data has more weight.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.FinancialFormula TripleExponentialMovingAverage = int32(25)

summary.span: The Triple Exponential Moving Average is based on a triple moving average of the closing price.

span.span: The Triple Exponential Moving Average is based on a triple moving average of the closing price.

summary.span: Its purpose is to eliminate short cycles.

span.span: Its purpose is to eliminate short cycles.

summary.span: This indicator keeps the closing price in trends that are shorter than the specified period.

span.span: This indicator keeps the closing price in trends that are shorter than the specified period.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.FinancialFormula TypicalPrice = int32(26)

summary.span: Typical Price is the average value of daily prices, and can be used as a filter for trend indicators.

span.span: Typical Price is the average value of daily prices, and can be used as a filter for trend indicators.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.FinancialFormula VolatilityChaikins = int32(27)

summary.span: The Volatility Chaikins indicator measures the difference between High and Low prices, and is used to indicate tops or bottoms of the market.

span.span: The Volatility Chaikins indicator measures the difference between High and Low prices, and is used to indicate tops or bottoms of the market.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.FinancialFormula VolumeOscillator = int32(28)

summary.span: The Volume Oscillator attempts to identify trends in volume by comparing two moving averages: one with a short period and another with a longer period.

span.span: The Volume Oscillator attempts to identify trends in volume by comparing two moving averages: one with a short period and another with a longer period.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.FinancialFormula WeightedClose = int32(29)

summary.span: The Weighted Close formula calculates the average value of daily prices.

span.span: The Weighted Close formula calculates the average value of daily prices.

summary.span: The only difference between Typical Price and the Weighted Close is that the closing price has extra weight, and is considered the most important price.

span.span: The only difference between Typical Price and the Weighted Close is that the closing price has extra weight, and is considered the most important price.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.FinancialFormula WeightedMovingAverage = int32(30)

summary.span: Weighted Moving Average is an average of data that is calculated over a period of time, where greater weight is attached to the most recent data.

span.span: Weighted Moving Average is an average of data that is calculated over a period of time, where greater weight is attached to the most recent data.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.FinancialFormula WilliamsR = int32(31)

summary.span: Williams %R is a momentum indicator, and is used to measure overbought and oversold levels.

span.span: Williams %R is a momentum indicator, and is used to measure overbought and oversold levels.
